page.title: 02LANDSCAPE-LT.GADDESDEN AREA
page.content: The woodland around Little Gaddesden is mostly deciduous trees like Beech and Oak .Nearly all the woods belong to Ashridge or the National Trust. There are many different flowers and plants scattered about the woods. In Spring there are bluebells,primroses and violets. In Summer there are strawberries and blackberries. The woods are also a perfect home for birds like pheasants,woodpeckers and smaller birds like the wren and robin. Around Ashridge you see a lot of different kinds of deer which include muntjack and fallow and a white deer has been seen. Apart from deer there are animals like rabbits and foxes. Where there is no woodland there are fields which mostly contain crops like wheat, corn or else cattle. There are open spaces used for recreation.
